title: How to Make Seaweed Tea Liquid Fertiliser

steps.headline: Gather the seaweed.
steps.description: Make sure it is lawful to do so and do not pillage your local beach! Look for seaweed that isn't too stinky and is still wet.

steps.headline: Rinse the seaweed to remove some of the excess salt.
Fill a bucket or barrel to three quarters way with water.
steps.description: Add as much seaweed as will fit and leave to soak.

steps.headline: Stir the seaweed mix every two to four days.
Allow to soak for several weeks to several months.
steps.description: The fertiliser grows stronger over time. Make sure to keep the brew somewhere that its odours won't affect your daily household. It is ready for use when it no longer carries a smell of ammonium.

steps.headline: Use as needed.
steps.description: When it is ready, use as a fertiliser on your plants and garden beds (soil). It should be diluted with water at a minimum of three parts to one.

text: Gather the seaweed. Make sure it is lawful to do so and do not pillage your local beach! Look for seaweed that isn't too stinky and is still wet. Rinse the seaweed to remove some of the excess salt.  Fill a bucket or barrel to three quarters way with water. Add as much seaweed as will fit and leave to soak. Stir the seaweed mix every two to four days.  Allow to soak for several weeks to several months. The fertiliser grows stronger over time. Make sure to keep the brew somewhere that its odours won't affect your daily household. It is ready for use when it no longer carries a smell of ammonium. Use as needed. When it is ready, use as a fertiliser on your plants and garden beds (soil). It should be diluted with water at a minimum of three parts to one.
sentences: Make sure it is lawful to do so and do not pillage your local beach!
Look for seaweed that isn't too stinky and is still wet.
Rinse the seaweed to remove some of the excess salt.
Fill a bucket or barrel to three quarters way with water.
Add as much seaweed as will fit and leave to soak.
Stir the seaweed mix every two to four days.
Allow to soak for several weeks to several months.
The fertiliser grows stronger over time.
Make sure to keep the brew somewhere that its odours won't affect your daily household.
It is ready for use when it no longer carries a smell of ammonium.
When it is ready, use as a fertiliser on your plants and garden beds (soil).
It should be diluted with water at a minimum of three parts to one.
